intro: Tapinanthus tambermensis, commonly known as the parasitic orchid, is a hemiparasitic plant that derives some of its nutrients from host plants. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. The plant typically grows as a small, flowering vine with yellow or greenish-yellow flowers. It lacks chlorophyll, relying on its host for photosynthetic support. Its unique parasitic nature makes it an interesting subject in botanical studies.
